title: Build script not using the same target features as the actual binary
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->
Not sure if this is an actual issue with Rust, it might be cargo's fault.
When I try to cross-compile my binary from Windows to the Linux-musl target the build script does not use bmi2, whereas the binary uses bmi2.
I tried this code:
`src/build.rs`
```rust
use std::fs::File;
use std::io::Write;
use std::path::Path;
pub fn main(){
    let out_dir = std::env::var("OUT_DIR").unwrap();
    let mut file = File::create(Path::new(&out_dir).join("test.rs")).unwrap();
    #[cfg(all(target_arch = "x86_64", target_feature = "bmi2"))]
    {write!(file, "pub const BMI2: bool = true;").unwrap();}
    #[cfg(not(all(target_arch = "x86_64", target_feature = "bmi2")))]
    {write!(file, "pub const BMI2: bool = false;").unwrap();}
}
```
`src/main.rs`
```rust
include!(concat!(env!("OUT_DIR"), "/test.rs"));
fn main() {
    println!("Build bmi2: {}", BMI2);
    #[cfg(all(target_arch = "x86_64", target_feature = "bmi2"))]
    {println!("Actual bmi2: true")}
    #[cfg(not(all(target_arch = "x86_64", target_feature = "bmi2")))]
    {println!("Actual bmi2: false")}
}
```

I expected to see this happen: If no `RUSTFLAGS` specified, output should be false, false. If compilation with bmi2 target-feature enabled, output should be true, true.

Instead, this happened after compilation with
`cargo rustc --target x86_64-unknown-linux-musl -- -C target-cpu=native`
Output in my VirtualBox:
```
fabian@fabian-VirtualBox:~/Schreibtisch$ '/home/fabian/Schreibtisch/Test' 
Build bmi2: false
Actual bmi2: true
```
Issue does not occur with normal target.
